field.label: Enable Single Sign On with SAML 2.0

action.label: Show warning modal if sso is being disabled

skuid__text.contents: Are you sure you want to disable SSO login options for all users?
If disabled, users will always be asked to log in with their username/password.

action.label: Don't show toast if users click Cancel from modal

field.label: Activity Session Timeout
field.helptext: How long a user's session will last, from last session activity, before the user must log in again.

field.label: Absolute Session Timeout
field.helptext: How long a user's session will last, from login time, regardless of activity, before the user must log in again.

field.label: Roaming Sessions
field.helptext: If this option is enabled, then user sessions will remain active under a single session ID even if the user's browser and IP address change. This is more vulnerable to session hijacking.

field.label: Token Expiration
field.helptext: How many hours a user password reset token will be valid for when it is generated.

field.label: Hide Username/Password Login option
field.helptext: If enabled, then the option to login with a username and password will be hidden from the login screen. If there is a problem with SSO, an admin can still login with a username/password by going to "/ui/login?method=any".

field.label: Default SSO Provider
field.helptext: If a default SSO Provider is selected, then when a user who is not logged in attempts to access an authenticated route, the user will be automatically sent to their SSO Provider. If the user is already logged in to their SSO Provider, then the user will be automatically logged in to Skuid and taken to the route they were trying to go to.
This determines which login method appears when users first access your site.Â

field.label: Login Button Text
field.placeholder: Login with my <designated identify provider> account

entry.label: The name identifier element of the subject statement
Import from identity provider metadata file
Import identity provider metadata file - from specified URL

field.label: Audience URI / Service Provider Entity ID / Metadata URL

action.label: Set SSO to disabled if there's no ID Provider in the SSOConfig model

field.label: Show on Login Screen
field.helptext: Should this Identity Provider show on your SSO Login Screen

skuid__text.contents: You haven't set up identity providers for this site.

Designating a Single Sign-On provider allows end users to log into one identity provider to access multiple different services. 
To learn more about Single Sign-on configuration in Skuid, read our
SSO documentation

When a default SSO Provider is selected:
  • If a user attempts to access an authenticated site, they will be sent to their SSO provider to log in.
  • If the user is already logged in to their SSO provider, they will be automatically logged into Skuid and taken to the site.
Are you sure you want to permanently delete this identity provider? You can't undo this.
This determines which login method appears when users first access your site.

enableConditions.message: This is only available if you have selected Use Custom SSO Login Heading
